description.raw:
A nice counterpart to computing the mean of a signal is computing its variance. This pull request adds `SignalVariance` which uses an incremental ("online") algorithm, that is [credited to Knuth and others](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithms_for_calculating_variance#Online_algorithm). I added some basic tests, as well as a test using normally distributed random values with expectations on the [expected sample variance](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variance#Distribution_of_the_sample_variance) that I borrowed from [Noise_TEST.cc in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/82df42e8f4b5861bfb79bc718261e5b19ce89a7f/gazebo/sensors/Noise_TEST.cc#cl-150).

* [drone.io is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/105)
* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/11/)
* [windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/4/console), though it didn't run the tests (@\_jrivero_)

title: Add SignalVariance to SignalStats
